intro: Malvastrum wilczekii var. genuinum, commonly known as the Mexican mallow, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and it typically grows in sunny, well-drained soils. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is part of the Malvaceae family. This species is valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
